title: Listen to Britain
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/City and town life
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1939-1945 - Great Britain
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/War and society
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1939-1945
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/War damage to buildings - Great Britain
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/City and town life
description: The sights and sounds of a people at war, told without commentary or dialogue - the roar of tanks and planes, the voices of children, the multi lingual radio commentators, Commonwealth soldiers, Flanagan and Allen singing "Underneath the Arches", Myra Hess playing a Mozart concerto, a military brass band counterpointed with genius and affection to scenes in streets and factories and country places. This film is considered one of the most successful of the documentary films of Humphrey Jennings.
